_meta.description: Fact-check methodology v3.2 — source-free prompts with dynamically generated claims from active website databases.
_meta.note: Legacy static category claim catalogs were removed. Claims are generated dynamically from MASTER.json, CITY_PROFILES.json, WEBSITE_CONTENT.json, and COMPENSATION_DATA.json.

internalMethods._note: These are internal calculations. Verify reasonableness and arithmetic consistency rather than searching for direct one-to-one external values.

digitalStemPlus.label: Tech STEM+ Graduate Count
digitalStemPlus.description: Custom aggregation of digitally-relevant graduate pipelines.
digitalStemPlus.disclaimer: Derived metric; validate plausibility and formula consistency.

salaryIndex.label: Salary Index (Lisbon=100)
salaryIndex.description: Regional salary normalization relative to Lisbon baseline.
salaryIndex.disclaimer: Derived index; validate trend and relative-position plausibility.

ictPercentage.label: ICT % of STEM
ictPercentage.description: Ratio of core ICT graduates to broader digital graduate pipeline.
ictPercentage.disclaimer: Derived ratio; verify arithmetic and contextual plausibility.

costComparisons.label: Cost Comparison Claims
costComparisons.description: Relative affordability statements derived from cost indices.
costComparisons.disclaimer: Derived comparisons; verify directional plausibility and math.

statusCodes.description: Evidence supports the value within ±5% tolerance or practical equivalent range
Directionally correct with material variance or mixed-quality evidence
No defensible verification basis after reasonable estimation attempts
Evidence exists but is materially stale for current-market claims (>24 months)

confidenceLevels.description: Multiple independent and recent evidence points align
Estimate-heavy assessment with weak direct evidence

rules: Treat claim text as source-free input
Do not rely on predefined source lists
Always include source_url (or N/A), source_ref, and data_period
